meanings.definition: Settled particles at the bottom of a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The sedimented sand formed a layer at the bottom of the jar.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the sedimented particles in the test tube.
meanings.sent3: The fish swam above the sedimented debris, looking for food.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like sedimented layers, each one holding memories.
meanings.sent5: The sedimented mud created a murky layer at the lake's bottom.

meanings.definition: Deposited material that has settled out of a liquid.
meanings.sent1: After the flood, the sedimented debris covered the streets.
meanings.sent2: The sedimented silt formed a thick layer on the riverbank.
meanings.sent3: The kids built a castle with the sedimented sand from the beach.
meanings.sent4: The sedimented leaves on the ground created a colorful carpet.
meanings.sent5: The sedimented clay hardened into a solid mass over time.

meanings.definition: Accumulated matter that has settled over time.
meanings.sent1: The sedimented dust on the shelves needed to be cleaned.
meanings.sent2: The sedimented rocks in the cave showed layers of history.
meanings.sent3: The sedimented memories of childhood brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: The sedimented emotions in his heart finally found release.
meanings.sent5: The sedimented snow on the mountain glowed in the sunlight.
